channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Families describe major communication failures, as St Basil’s Homes for the Aged in Melbourne is overrun with COVID-19.
item.title: Nicholas Barboussas was told his elderly father in aged care was fine. He wasn't.

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: They are the four-legged, mostly forgotten victims of the pandemic.
item.title: From Delhi to Cairo, Australians are rescuing animals abandoned by collapse in tourism

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Six of the cases reported on Sunday were traced to the growing number of cases at the western Sydney restaurant.
item.title: Restaurant cluster continues to grow in NSW as Victoria records deadliest day

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: All the major developments as the COVID-19 pandemic continues.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia's deadliest day sees 10 deaths, 459 new COVID-19 cases for Victoria, Sydney Black Lives Matter protest contested in Supreme Court

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Shaun Burgoyne has again dodged a suspension from match review officer despite laying another dangerous tackle, this time on Sydney youngster James Rowbottom.
item.title: Hawks' Burgoyne avoids ban for dangerous tackle

item.description: Alan Moir, The Sydney Morning Herald's political cartoonist, sketches the political unreality.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Alan Moir

item.description: In an abrupt response to the outbreak, Britainadvised its citizens not to travel to Spain and will require visitors returning from Spain to spend 14 days in quarantine.
item.title: Spain takes aim at nightclubs and beaches as virus rebounds

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 26, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 25, 2020

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: People refusing to wear masks in public have clashed with police and retail workers as the government doubles down on the mandatory mask requirement on a deadly day.
item.title: Police, retail employees clash with Victorians refusing to wear face masks

item.dc:creator: Brad Elborough
item.description: West Coast was thrust into premiership favouritism during this week and their form on Sunday against Collingwood suggests that the hype is well-deserved.
item.title: Kennedy boots seven as the Eagles put the Pies to the sword

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: A man in his 40s has become the youngest Victorian to die from COVID-19, as doctors warn many Australians have common health problems that put them at greater risk of harm from coronavirus.
item.title: Australia's deadliest COVID-19 day: State records 459 new cases and 10 deaths

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Panthers return from the Gold Coast with nine wins, one draw and one loss from 11 matches this season.
item.title: Panthers record best start in club history at expense of gritty Titans

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: After the Sky Blues had to cancel their pre-planned celebrations when they were unable to secure a win at home on Tuesday, players marked the premiership win with text messages from their respective couches.
item.title: Group chat champions: Sydney FC celebrate premiership via WhatsApp

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The closure will take place between Charlotte and Elizabeth streets, with pedestrian and Royal Albert Hotel access maintained, as work steps up on the Cross River Rail site.
item.title: Further traffic restrictions for Albert Street as new station work pushes on

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Follow the Sunday football action, with live scores for Crows v Dons and Dees v Lions, with Eagles v Pies our featured match with commentary.
item.title: Live AFL: Essendon win thriller, Pies start grudge match with Eagles

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Two jockeys who sprinted down the Rosehill straight to check on a fellow rider after a horrific race fall have told of their fear at what they would find.
item.title: 'Scary scene': Adkins' first helpers rally around hospitalised rider

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Canberra prop had earlier this year refused to have the flu shot. But the wounded Raiders are expected to breathe a massive sigh of relief this week.
item.title: Papalii to be cleared for Cowboys trip after flu vaccine drama

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: AFL players are no longer allowed to enter their teammates' private rooms at hub accommodation after the league tightened its coronavirus protocols.
item.title: Players banned from entering teammates' rooms in hubs

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The four young people hailed from communities scattered from Upper Mount Gravatt to Townsville. The University offered its "deepest sympathies" to the students' families.
item.title: Townsville university students among four killed in 'terrible' crash

item.description: Australian former UFC middleweight champion Robert Whittaker earned his first victory in two years, winning with a unanimous decision over England's Darren Till.
item.title: Whittaker back on track with victory on Fight Island

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The inspiration the Treasurer is drawing from Thatcher and Reagan draws a warning from Labor, but business leaders and economists argue it has some merit.
item.title: Treasurer's inspiration from Thatcher, Reagan has merit: Economists

item.description: Form will go under the spotlight when the races head to a heavy track at Monday's wet Cessnock meeting.
item.title: Tallis looks a treat if he can pull off Perfect Style

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race guide and tips for Cessnock on Monday

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Racing Victoria's international wish list for this year’s spring carnival is already half full, with just over half a dozen spots left up for grabs for Melbourne’s feature races.
item.title: Spots running out for this year's spring carnival

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Raising the age of criminal responsibility would deliver both a social and an economic dividend.
item.title: Putting children under 14 in jail is wrong and wasteful

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Football or soccer? The argument over what to call the world game in Australia has been going on for decades but rarely, if ever, has it played out in a legal setting.
item.title: Football or soccer? Crocmedia takes argument to the law ... and loses

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Not letting COVID-19 cramp their style, Victoria's ultra runners have invented a mad relay through 197 suburbs and towns.
item.title: 'They don't do things by halves': Ultra-runners fired up by 'Rona Relay

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: The federal government has defended JobKeeper payments to leading Sydney private schools unable to house boarders during the COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Treasurer defends JobKeeper payments to leading private schools

item.description: New York tailors say it is a similar story across the world: people need a bit more breathing room in their clothing.
item.title: ‘Everybody got fat!’ Tailors know what you did during lockdown

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: A prominent Melbourne lawyer has been accused of pressuring a witness and threatening the man's elderly mother in profane text messages.
item.title: 'C U in 15': Lawyer accused of pressuring witness and threatening mother

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Chloe McCardel has received an exemption from the Australia government to travel to the UK amid the pandemic to try and add four more crossings to her resume.
item.title: Australian swimmer chasing records with a few more laps of the English Channel

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Peter V’landys has indicated Williams will get an exemption from a rule prohibiting players from having two contracts at once, allowing him to re-join the Roosters.
item.title: 'Extraordinary times': NRL to bend the rules for Sonny Bill Williams

item.description: The first three quarters were played largely on Essendon's terms before the Crows, chasing their first victory in almost an entire year, summoned a brave fourth-quarter fightback.
item.title: Bombers hold on to beat Crows

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Lectures will continue to be held online but many tutorials, seminars and small group activities will be held in person.
item.title: It's masked, monitored and sanitised, but life is returning to Sydney's university campuses

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Adam O'Brien blasted his Knights for their "sense of entitlement" after Sunday's shock to loss the Bulldogs. The coach also has a hooking headache following season-ending injuries to Andrew McCullough and Connor Watson.
item.title: Knights' hooking curse worsens as Bulldogs stun top-four contenders

item.description: Dr Richard Harris, the South Australian anaesthetist who played a crucial role in the Thai cave rescue in 2018, is a compelling subject.
item.title: Anh Do paints a portrait of bravery in new Anh's Brush With Fame

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Sydney chairman Andrew Pridham says dig at Swans star Tom Papley diminished Alastair Clarkson's standing in the game.
item.title: Swans chairman whacks Clarkson for Papley comments

item.dc:creator: Michael Bailey
item.description: A medical doctor as well as a musician, Gordi cured the COVID blues in this cathartic show livestreamed from Sydney Opera House
item.title: Silence became Gordi's soul-baring songs

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Another western Sydney council was declared a coronavirus hotspot amid further growth in cases across NSW throughout the week.
item.title: 'Complacency is our enemy': No new cases but Qld eyes southern outbreaks

item.description: Matt Crouch and Jacob Townsend have both been reported for headbutting in a bizarre incident after the half-time siren of the fiery Adelaide-Essendon clash at Adelaide Oval.
item.title: Townsend, Matt Crouch reported for headbutting in bizarre half-time incident

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Justice Mark Ierace delivered the judgment on Sunday afternoon after a court hearing that went into Friday evening.
item.title: Supreme Court grants prohibition order over Sydney Black Lives Matter protest

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Wamberal is preparing to be hit by heavy rain and large swells on Sunday night after suffering significant erosion last week.
item.title: 'Cross our fingers': Central Coast residents prepare for another storm

item.description: Authorities are attempting to shelter and evacuate people while also maintaining social distancing protocols and other pandemic restrictions.
item.title: Hurricane Hanna lashes south Texas coast, already beset by COVID

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: As the bridal industry responds to changing restrictions because of the pandemic, there is one element enjoying a sentimental shift: the wedding dress.
item.title: 'Something old': the growing popularity of the personal wedding dress
